result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:00 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Samuel J Peterson Kamp in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Samuel J Peterson Kamp. 
Atty Nimmer requests a new hearing date and updates the court with the status of the matter.
Hearing scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 03:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance report dated 09-30-2022 received and filed.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:19 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Samuel J Peterson Kamp in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Samuel J Peterson Kamp. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.

1:28 PM Defendant Samuel J Peterson Kamp in court, in custody.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.  Attorney Jeffrey Jensen Jr. appears as friend of the court. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
